Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023

About This Course

Welcome to the Michigan Ongoing Health and Safety Training Refresher 2023. This training was developed to meet the federal requirement for ongoing health and safety training under the Child Care and Development Block Grant. In Michigan, all child care providers (licensed and license exempt) are required to complete an annual health and safety refresher training.  Each year, a required refresher health and safety training will be offered to meet the  federal requirement. 

This Training is Brought to you by:

Learning Objectives

CHILD CARE PROVIDERS WILL CAPTURE A RENEWED KNOWLEDGE OF:

  • Administration of Medications
  • Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, including Immunizations
  • Prevention and Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions
  • Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants

Course Outline

Section 1:
Administration of Medications

Section 2:
Prevention & Response to Emergencies Due to Food & Allergic Reactions

Section 3:
Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Section 4:
Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-Contaminants

Licensing Rules

This course is designed to meet the ongoing health and safety training requirement for licensed and license exempt child care providers. It is the responsibility of all child care providers working in licensed programs (child care centers or homes) to be familiar with and adhere to all licensing rules related to the topics discussed in this training. For license exempt child care providers, these rules should be viewed as recommendations


For those of you that are working in licensed programs (child care center, family child care home or group child care home), there will be occasions in this training where specific licensing rules will be emphasized; however, there will be other licensing rules that are related to a specific topic that will not be included in the training. Time constraints and the diversity of the audience, prevent us from addressing the majority of rules related to these topics. The focus of this training is to provide a good overview and discuss best practices related to the health and safety topics.


If you are working in a licensed child care program, it is your responsibility to be familiar with and adhere to all licensing rules specific to your setting (center or home). 


Providers with specific licensing questions are encouraged to consult their respective licensing rules or reach out to their licensing consultant.

Facilitation

This course is an open entry and open exit course and is not facilitated. Grading for this course is solely based on "complete" or "incomplete." In order to receive completion, you must view and interact with all of the pages throughout this course. The completion of and feedback on activities have been automated to provide you with the ability to work at a pace appropriate to you as you complete your learning. The learning activities are designed to give you formative feedback throughout the course while summative assessments are used to provide you with information about your knowledge and to collect completion data for the course.


If you do need to talk to a human, please reach out to our Customer Care Center.
